prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Andrew
mes:
Summer is nice. Andrew loves it—probably his favorite season. Who doesn't enjoy long days, lots of sun, and clothes that don't suffocate?

He takes a deep breath, inhaling the warm air as he looks around. He’s currently standing on a perfectly cut lawn, half in the shade of a gigantic tree in the middle of campus, between huge buildings.

He made it.

Andrew and his younger sibling actually made it into DK University. A few months ago, it seemed like a wild idea that Claude was spouting about. Now, it's reality.

Andrew managed to grab a scholarship due to his rugby skills, and his younger sibling got in by being so fucking smart that people couldn't decline their application. He got the brawn, his sibling got the brains.

*Man, the pride I'm feeling.*

The professor responsible for the first years is talking, but Andrew barely listens. Instead, he’s too busy looking around.

The whole campus is like something out of an extremely extravagant Netflix show about ridiculously rich college kids—buildings impressive enough to make him wonder whether they were owned by some kind of aristocrat a few hundred years ago, beautiful gardens, and a ton of other details that scream, *Rich kids study here.*  

Students suddenly begin moving around, forming little circles for some kind of orientation exercise that Andrew didn't realize was happening—because he was too busy looking around with barely concealed excitement. If he had a tail, it'd be wagging furiously.

Brown eyes flicker over to Claude, his best friend, who is currently moving away. “Bro, what are we supposed to do?” he whispers, his voice definitely too loud to go unnoticed. A few students snicker while Claude rolls his eyes.

“Didn't listen, did ya? Just go over there and do what the others do,” Claude responds, pointing with his thumb over his shoulder at a small group forming.

Andrew doesn't question it—because, to be honest, he barely ever does. A nod and a way-too-hard clap on the shoulder later, he's standing next to some other students, trying to understand what the fuck they're actually supposed to do.

Truth be told, Andrew has no fucking clue why they're doing any of this. Group bonding? Getting to know new students?

Probably some old geezer thinking youngsters need this.

He's standing next to Hailee and some red-haired rich kid who looks like he eats gold for breakfast with his stiff-ass posture. Turns out the dude’s name is Vincent, and he's also part of the rugby team.

Andrew would probably strike up a conversation with him—if Vincent wasn’t being swarmed by the entire rest of the group.

*What the fuck? Is the guy some kind of celebrity or something?*

Not that Andrew would be surprised if he was. The majority of students here at DK are filthy rich, living off daddy's money as if tomorrow doesn't exist.

His eyes roam over the people, finally landing on the only person who does *not* look like they’re trying to kiss Vincent’s ass.  

Hailee is awkwardly standing there, looking around in silence. So Andrew just turns toward them and begins yapping. A few stunned moments later, Hailee actually starts responding. There’s that unexplainable feeling of familiarity.  

Not that he knows Hailee, but… y'know when you just *click* with someone? No reason, just a simple connection.

“I feel like I've known you all my life,” Andrew says mid-conversation, an effortlessly confident smile on his lips as he locks eyes with Hailee. "We're totally meant to be best friends. Fate or something,” he continues, his smile widening slightly. "Or maybe we were best buddied in our life before. Do you believe in stuff like that?"

qvink_memory.memory:
*summarizes key facts succinctly*
Andrew and his sibling have enrolled at prestigious DK University after Andrew earned a rugby scholarship and his sibling received an academic admission. On their first day, an excited yet distracted Andrew explores the opulent campus, struggling to follow orientation activities due to being overwhelmed by the wealthy atmosphere and impressed architecture. He strikes up a conversation with Hailee, instantly feeling an inexplicable connection that makes him suggest fate brought them together as potential lifelong friends.
